website_summaries.verdict: Fits in a pocket and provides instant luminosity measurements.
pros: Reviews rave that this meter works especially well for set design and other indoor spaces
Effectively measures temperature and UV strength as well
cons: May need to adjust thermometer calibration

website_summaries.verdict: A versatile light meter that makes lighting an area easier than other meter options.
pros: Large screen is big enough to display multiple readings at the same time
Reads ambient temperature in addition to the surrounding luminosity levels
cons: Integrated thermometer can arrive out of calibration, throwing off inaccurate readings by several degrees

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a PAR meter
customer_reviews.text: The accuracy is going to be off if you are measuring LED this is for Sunlight and HID ie. MH and or HPS. It does read LED just not accurately; and it is better than guessing. NOTE: If reading LED with this -2000 LUX from your reading. HID LUX RECOMMENDED: •Seedlings 5000-7000 LUX •Vegetation 15000-45000 LUX •Flower 45000-75000 LUX
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Essential for therapy light evaluation!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I knew to buy this before I ordered several therapy lamps that later proved to be unsatifactory. When I finally got this meter, I could accurately measure the lux in front of my face (measured at the bridge of my nose), and found most therapy lamps over-stated their light production. I wound up creating my own therapy light by assembling products purchased from Amazon, and now have the best light imaginable, and far superior to what the market offers. I love this meter for providing the information I needed and I highly recommend the meter.
customer_reviews.author: shops2xs

customer_reviews.title: Just purchased Our 5th URCERI meter for measuring light for proper tropical plant placement
customer_reviews.text: Accurate sturdy good value to price for use in front of our clients when measuring given light for plants. We are a boutique business with corporate clientswe design install and maintain live plants as we start with light meter readings and use these exclusively for our business a very important tool as footcandles of light is key to plant proper placement for plant to live and thrive
customer_reviews.author: Gwynhvar

customer_reviews.title: handheld convenience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for photography and it's really easy to use and change units. But because of the onboarding temperature readout as well as lighting I can see this being useful for people growing "vegetables" in their own little grow ops. I know most modern digital cameras have light sensors and even apertures that adjust to the light conditions for ideal photos, but if you want to know the amount of light on your subject for your own mental reference and you dont want to break the bank I'd suggest this.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Vokey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent light meter for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to evaluate the light output of SAD therapy lights and also measure area lighting intensity within my home. It worked perfectly for both applications. The meter is well designed, easy to use, and seems accurate, at least enough for my use. Very pleased...
customer_reviews.author: R. Seehoffer

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent light meter
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent light meter. It measures Lux, which are lumens/sq cm. The range covers from full outdoor sunlight to low and medium levels indoors. Although I have no standard to compare it against, it appears to be reliable and repeatable. It is well made.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I use this meter in my macro photography studio. It is reliable and fast and very easy to use. Great value for the money and solid design. I like the way they tether the cap that covers the light sensor. Won’t be losing that anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: LD

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not well made, I can’t verify if it’s accurate, but it seems repeatable. The temp measuring is a joke, it takes hours to equlabrate, the sensor must be on the board, poor design. It auto ranges and the decimal point is tiny, so you have to be careful when reading, it moves to “K” without warning . I suspect it is not a full spectrum detector so it won’t properly measure some wavelengths, like LEDs. It works, but it seems to be a middle school science project, not a well made instrument.
customer_reviews.author: NoneOfYourBiz

customer_reviews.title: Sensor Settling Time
customer_reviews.text: It seems the sensor is accurate, however, there is some settling time. This is the first light sensor I've used, so I'm not sure if it's unique to this one, or all sensors. If you turn on the sensor and then turn on a bright light, it overshoots the reading, then slowly...very slowly trickles down to an accurate value. That said, I tested a custom, dimmable light, and it tracked linearly from 0 to 100%
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Measure and compare light output of different sources.
customer_reviews.text: I can compare light output from fluorescent light to led light in lux or lumens or even candle power in min or max mode. It also measures lumens and candle power of incandescent bulbs or any other light source. Thank you for this fine product.
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: Consistency was a real problem
customer_reviews.text: I could take the same measurement of the same bulb with the meter mounted in a set position and get wildly different results. It was bad enough that I had to take an average. For the cost, if you need it and are willing to play with it a bunch, OK, but I just cant' see using it and am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: TCTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wildly inaccurate, highly directional
customer_reviews.text: It’s inaccurate but consistently so. It reads a fair bit off from a known level but always does so in a predictable way. Since I only need this for looking for hot spots on a stage it’s okay. Despite having a hemispherical dome I have found it to be a lot more directional than expected. I don’t know that this is because of the way the plastic shields the dome because it seems even more directional than that would indicate. But it is very cheap so cut it some slack.
customer_reviews.author: GoClick

customer_reviews.title: Accurate; Simple
customer_reviews.text: Very handy for a variety of lighting issues. Porch light too bright for ordinance? This will tell you. Going blind trying to read by lamplight? This will help you figure out if you need more wattage or an optometrist.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Economical and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Works great if you know what a Lux is. The conversion to Lumens is ........a bit confusing ? Otherwise , at least I know that I have twice as much light in the garage than before.
customer_reviews.author: Ken L

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like the one handed operation and that it holds and minimum and maximum value. Backlit lcd screen seems to be bright enough for uses under bright lights. Best part is that you dont need to select a decimal point. The readout automatically displays the exact number. With the meter I got I can just multiply the readout by .0165 to get a relative par value under white light sources. That’s info for all the plant growers though.
customer_reviews.author: Growing Answers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome little device. If you don’t have the cash for a lumens meter then go this route. I don’t use it for photography but I’m sure you’ll find it useful if you need Lux readings. I just went outside in bright sunlight and that’s my benchmark.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: This device is great
customer_reviews.text: I use it multiple times per day checking my LED grow room lighting. This device is almost a second extension of my own hand now. I have no clue if there is better, but this one work perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: It works so much better than the apps you can buy. I know this because the numbers remain consistent when you stay in the same spot with no change in lighting. I take 3 measurements in a spot with very little variation in numbers. The apps fluctuate like crazy, even the paid ones. I use it to make sure I can stay compliant with code whilst reducing light in a commercial space.
customer_reviews.author: AmznAddictTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: And works as described. Although does not give par or ppfd. U can still use this to convert it to determine the needs for your pants. Much cheaper than a par reader
customer_reviews.author: Phon  Vongdara

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Not the functions of a $600 meter,, however you can grab a close average. For the money I would recommend this meter.
customer_reviews.author: BluesJamJim

customer_reviews.title: Wondering how bright something is? Shed a little light on it with this handy device.
customer_reviews.text: This lux meter is perfect for determining the brightness of flashlights, bulbs, rooms, and everything else you ever needed to know. In the market for a new flashlight and want to make sure the sellers claims of brightness are honest? Grab one of these guys and have all the proof you need. I'm very pleased with the simplicity and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob collins

customer_reviews.title: Hard to read at some angles
customer_reviews.text: The meter is decent and easy to use. BUT its very hard to see in sunlight. The display is most visible when the unit is at a 45 degree angle. When you look straight on, it much dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. D.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, great value...
customer_reviews.text: I like everything like birds and colors and food and sometimes people and laughter and exploring and innovating and designing and mitigating and prototyping and if you're still reading you may just be your due diligence on a level above your average mo-fo, just saying, you earned it..
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ganner

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this product.This also gives indoor temperature.This light meter covers the basics well, and I used it for LED lighting work.
customer_reviews.author: Ming lee

customer_reviews.title: Great little Lux meter
customer_reviews.text: I was really surprised how clear the display was and also that it automatically switches contrasts when placed under bright or dull lighting making it easy to read no matter what. Fast shipping too, instructions were easy to follow and device was easy to operate. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: tonypalooza

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, works fine, and is cheap
customer_reviews.text: I use this for measuring output of white LEDs at my engineering job. It works fine, I've used it about 2-3 weeks. I don't know how well it is calibrated, but it does what I need and was very inexpensive. The max feature is what I use the most. No problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Slonim

customer_reviews.title: Not very accurate but sufficient for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy it for measuring room temp but it is 8 degrees off - too high - in a 72 degree room. That's a little over a 10% error. I'm assuming the light measurements are likewise off by a similar amount. My light measurements don't require a great degree of accuracy so it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: art

customer_reviews.title: Works okay except for LED lights
customer_reviews.text: Thus unit works well for most lights but does not work for LED to measure PAR. Spend the money for a mid range PAR meter (around 160 USD) to measure the quality and intensity of LED lights.
customer_reviews.author: hmk

customer_reviews.title: Works right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars for accuracy as it was within perimeters of products scale. Other than that, it works very well as it was purchased to get a quick reading for initial setup of light system. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: This thing stopped working after 1 year. I probably only used it 5-6 times. The backlight went out so now it’s useless as you can’t reas the screen. The built in thermometerreads 6 degrees F too high and cannot be calibrated (nothing in the instructions about it).
customer_reviews.author: Henry M.

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I was checking light from two vehicles making a comparison. I found the Min/Max feature particularly helpful. It is difficult to read the meter while taking the reading .
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Sweet addition and supplementation to knowledge and great for examples.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, in many examples, easy to use. Safe and well made device. Can be used outdoors. Good device to read different ambientes, indoor light power, dead spots in canopies / grow tents
customer_reviews.author: Rhanmis ortega

customer_reviews.title: This is the high-LIGHT of meters
customer_reviews.text: This is not an PAR meter. it measures the intensity of light. I use it to determine when my light are not putting out enough lights. I do that instead of keep track of hours.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Sears

customer_reviews.title: Great product, even better price!
customer_reviews.text: This product is better than expected for the price. I'm using it to get a better understanding of light in various situations for photography and videography, so far it is better than expected for the price point, as long as you remember to take off the light sensor cap!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Smash

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Useful and accurate, this light meter has been useful for measuring Lux as I get into growing my own vegetables and being self sustaining! It’s super easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Tron

customer_reviews.title: Good Device
customer_reviews.text: worked great once I got the correct instructions. The unit was sent with instructions for their sound level meter. Customer service was very prompt with emailing me the correct manual. Would of gave it a five star if I didn't have to mess with getting correct manual. Nice Product
customer_reviews.author: Walt

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Is perfect, I think is in fact really good for the price. Easy to use, read and the hold function is Praia d easy. Is perfect
customer_reviews.author: Jose L

customer_reviews.title: Bad info at point of sales
customer_reviews.text: Had to return. Maybe it would be nice and say this product is for incandescent light. Not what wanted. Would never have ordered it if I didn't have to wait until I had it at home reading general setup instructions to discover that. Can't say if it's good, bad or indifferent. Just lack of pre-purchase info
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Fair for the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't have anything to compare it to, but it seems to be a fairly good meter. It doesn't seem to be the sturdiest thing, but it's more than fair for the price. I mainly use it for checking the lighting for my plants.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak to the accuracy, as I have no other way to measure LUX. It was easy to use. However, I wish the light sensor could be rotated.
customer_reviews.author: vc

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to settle
customer_reviews.text: Took a minute to get repeatable results but for the price works pretty good. I use a laser for temp so I didn't test that function.
customer_reviews.author: Dashing Dan

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could calibrate this
customer_reviews.text: This meter works, but I don't know how accurate it is, since I don't have a reference. In any case, I'm not using it for professional productions/recordings, so it does its job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dex Masrey

customer_reviews.title: A must for growing in tents
customer_reviews.text: Use this to calculate my placement of orchids in their growing area. Does a great job in my grow tent
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not for LEDs in which was the main reason I bought it :(
customer_reviews.text: It works well but truthfully I should have paid attention to the reviews before I bought it. So it's useless to me but thank God it was cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Grossly inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be well made and does work to some degree but the recorded temperature is off by 7 degrees and the measured illumination recorded is about one tenth of the actual value. Instructions indicate that the unit was calibrated at the factory which would seem to be the source of the problem together with failure of the seller to do quality assurance testing. The unit is being returned to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Professional Engineer

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: Not sure exactly how it all works the instructions are not that great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stippich

customer_reviews.title: Kinda useless for grow lights.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says but it's kinda a useless tool.

customer_reviews.title: nice to know
customer_reviews.text: Los of dead spots in the plant room. Its nice to know how to move stuff around so they all get light .

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly...
customer_reviews.text: Checked the operation of it and it was in good order as advertised....an inexpensive alternative to much more expensive and capable meters.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt seem accurate
customer_reviews.text: Tempeture was 10 degrees off so how would you know the lux is even accurate? Will be returning

customer_reviews.title: Way better than I spec ted.
customer_reviews.text: We got it for a project, but now we can do a lot more. Great product.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for the Buck!
customer_reviews.text: The meter is very simple to use and makes it so easy to get your light in the sweet spot. I have not compared the light/temp reading to anything else, but it’s very consistent. FYI the temperature reading is in centigrade and I haven’t been able to get it to read farenehight...

customer_reviews.text: Great tool for monitoring late, would definitely recommend this to someone else

customer_reviews.title: Does what intended within NIST Standards....

product_meta.title: URCERI Light Meter Digital Illuminance Meter Handheld Ambient Temperature Measurer with Range up to 200,000 Lux Luxmeter with 4 Digit Color LCD Screen
feature_bullets: Measures luminosity from 0 to 200,000 Lux and ambient temperature
High accuracy of ±3% rdg ± 8 dgts (10,000 Lux)
4 digital color LCD screen, MIN/Max readings, data hold, auto power off, and low battery indication
Handheld design, lightweight and compact, easy to transport
Wide range of application, use lux light meter for set design, factory, office or home use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars572 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
